A_B_Test_Options_2.description: The settings specific to A/B test campaigns.

winning_campaign_id.description: ID of the campaign that was sent to the remaining recipients based on the winning combination.
winning_campaign_id.title: Winning Campaign ID

winner_criteria.description: The combination that performs the best. This may be determined automatically by click rate, open rate, or total revenue -- or you may choose manually based on the reporting data you find the most valuable. For Multivariate Campaigns testing send_time, winner_criteria is ignored. For Multivariate Campaigns with 'manual' as the winner_criteria, the winner must be chosen in the Mailchimp web application.
winner_criteria.title: Winning Criteria

wait_time.description: The number of minutes to wait before choosing the winning campaign. The value of wait_time must be greater than 0 and in whole hours, specified in minutes.
wait_time.title: Wait Time

test_size.description: The percentage of recipients to send the test combinations to, must be a value between 10 and 100.
test_size.title: Test Size

subject_lines.description: The possible subject lines to test. If no subject lines are provided, settings.subject_line will be used.
subject_lines.title: Subject Lines

send_times.description: The possible send times to test. The times provided should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. If send_times are provided to test, the test_size will be set to 100% and winner_criteria will be ignored.
send_times.title: Send Times

from_names.description: The possible from names. The number of from_names provided must match the number of reply_to_addresses. If no from_names are provided, settings.from_name will be used.
from_names.title: From Names

reply_to_addresses.description: The possible reply-to addresses. The number of reply_to_addresses provided must match the number of from_names. If no reply_to_addresses are provided, settings.reply_to will be used.
reply_to_addresses.title: Reply To Addresses

contents.description: Descriptions of possible email contents. To set campaign contents, make a PUT request to /campaigns/{campaign_id}/content with the field 'variate_contents'.
contents.title: Content Descriptions

combinations.description: Combinations of possible variables used to build emails.
combinations.title: Combinations

email_type.description: Type of email this member asked to get ('html' or 'text').

additionalProperties.description: This object's keys are merge tags (like FNAME). It's values are the values to be added to the merge field.

merge_fields.description: A dictionary of merge fields where the keys are the merge tags. See the [Merge Fields documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/merge-fields/#structure) for more about the structure.

additionalProperties.description: Keys are interest IDs, values are booleans that describe whether the list member is in that group or not.
additionalProperties.title: Interest Value

interests.description: The key of this object's properties is the ID of the interest in question.
interests.title: Subscriber Interests

ip_signup.description: IP address the subscriber signed up from.

timestamp_signup.description: The date and time the subscriber signed up for the list in ISO 8601 format.

A_B_Test_Options.description: The settings specific to A/B test campaigns.

winning_campaign_id.description: ID of the campaign that was sent to the remaining recipients based on the winning combination.
winning_campaign_id.title: Winning Campaign ID

winner_criteria.description: The combination that performs the best. This may be determined automatically by click rate, open rate, or total revenue -- or you may choose manually based on the reporting data you find the most valuable. For Multivariate Campaigns testing send_time, winner_criteria is ignored. For Multivariate Campaigns with 'manual' as the winner_criteria, the winner must be chosen in the Mailchimp web application.
winner_criteria.title: Winning Criteria

wait_time.description: The number of minutes to wait before choosing the winning campaign. The value of wait_time must be greater than 0 and in whole hours, specified in minutes.
wait_time.title: Wait Time

test_size.description: The percentage of recipients to send the test combinations to, must be a value between 10 and 100.
test_size.title: Test Size

subject_lines.description: The possible subject lines to test. If no subject lines are provided, settings.subject_line will be used.
subject_lines.title: Subject Lines

send_times.description: The possible send times to test. The times provided should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. If send_times are provided to test, the test_size will be set to 100% and winner_criteria will be ignored.
send_times.title: Send Times

from_names.description: The possible from names. The number of from_names provided must match the number of reply_to_addresses. If no from_names are provided, settings.from_name will be used.
from_names.title: From Names

reply_to_addresses.description: The possible reply-to addresses. The number of reply_to_addresses provided must match the number of from_names. If no reply_to_addresses are provided, settings.reply_to will be used.
reply_to_addresses.title: Reply To Addresses

root.title: API Root
root.description: The API root resource links to all other resources available in the API. Calling the root directory also returns details about the Mailchimp user account.

chimp-chatter.title: Chimp Chatter Activity
chimp-chatter.description: Get the latest Chimp Chatter activity from your account.

authorized-apps.title: Authorized Apps
authorized-apps.description: Manage registered, connected apps for your Mailchimp account with the Authorized Apps endpoints.

automation.title: Automations
automation.description: Mailchimp's classic automations feature lets you build a series of emails that send to subscribers when triggered by a specific date, activity, or event. Use the API to manage Automation workflows, emails, and queues. Does not include Customer Journeys.

automation-email.title: Emails
automation-email.description: Manage individual emails in a classic automation workflow.

automation-email-queue.title: Queue
automation-email-queue.description: Manage list member queues for classic automation emails.

automation-removed-subscribers.title: Removed Subscribers
automation-removed-subscribers.description: Remove subscribers from a classic automation workflow.

batch-operations.title: Batch Operations
batch-operations.description: Use batch operations to complete multiple operations with a single call.

account-exports.title: Account Exports
account-exports.description: Generate a new export or download a finished export.

campaigns.title: Campaigns
campaigns.description: Campaigns are how you send emails to your Mailchimp list. Use the Campaigns API calls to manage campaigns in your Mailchimp account.

campaign-feedback.title: Feedback
campaign-feedback.description: Post comments, reply to team feedback, and send test emails while you're working together on a Mailchimp campaign.

campaign-checklist.title: Send Checklist
campaign-checklist.description: Review the send checklist for your campaign, and resolve any issues before sending.

campaign-content.title: Content
campaign-content.description: Manage the HTML, plain-text, and template content for your Mailchimp campaigns.

connected-sites.title: Connected Sites
connected-sites.description: Manage sites you've connected to your Mailchimp account.

conversations.title: Conversations
conversations.description: Conversation tracking lets you view subscribers' replies to your campaigns in your Mailchimp account.

conversation-messages.title: Messages
conversation-messages.description: Manage messages in a specific campaign conversation.

file-manager.title: File Manager
file-manager.description: Manage files for your Mailchimp account. The File Manager is a place to store images, documents, and other files you include or link to in your campaigns, templates, or signup forms.

file-manager-folders.title: File Manager Folders
file-manager-folders.description: Manage specific folders in the File Manager for your Mailchimp account.

file-manager-files.title: File Manager Files
file-manager-files.description: Manage specific files in the File Manager for your Mailchimp account.

landing-pages.title: Landing Pages
landing-pages.description: Manage your Landing Pages, including publishing and unpublishing.

landing-pages_content.title: Content
landing-pages_content.description: The HTML content for your Mailchimp landing pages.

lists.title: Lists/Audiences
lists.description: Your Mailchimp list, also known as your audience, is where you store and manage all of your contacts.

list-members.title: Members
list-members.description: Manage members of a specific Mailchimp list, including currently subscribed, unsubscribed, and bounced members.

list-merges.title: Merge Fields
list-merges.description: Manage merge fields for an audience. See [Merge Field documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/merge-fields/) for more.

abuse-reports.title: Abuse Reports
abuse-reports.description: Manage abuse complaints for a specific list. An abuse complaint occurs when your recipient reports an email as spam in their mail program.

list-activity.title: Activity
list-activity.description: Get recent daily, aggregated activity stats for your list. For example, view unsubscribes, signups, total emails sent, opens, clicks, and more, for up to 180 days.

list-clients.title: Clients
list-clients.description: Get information about the most popular email clients for subscribers in a specific Mailchimp list.

list-growth-history.title: Growth History
list-growth-history.description: View a summary of the month-by-month growth activity for a specific list.

list-webhooks.title: Webhooks
list-webhooks.description: Manage webhooks for a specific Mailchimp list.

list-surveys.title: Surveys
list-surveys.description: Get survey data for this audience.

interest-categories.title: Interest Categories
interest-categories.description: Manage interest categories for a specific list. Interest categories organize interests, which are used to group subscribers based on their preferences. These correspond to 'group titles' in the Mailchimp application.

interests.title: Interests
interests.description: Manage interests for a specific Mailchimp list. Assign subscribers to interests to group them together. Interests are referred to as 'group names' in the Mailchimp application.

lists-tags-search.title: Tag Search
lists-tags-search.description: Search for tags on a list by name.

list-segments.title: Segments
list-segments.description: Manage segments and tags for a specific Mailchimp list. A segment is a section of your list that includes only those subscribers who share specific common field information. Tags are labels you create to help organize your contacts.

list-segment-members.title: Segment Members
list-segment-members.description: Manage list members in a saved segment.

list-member-activity.title: Member Activity
list-member-activity.description: Get details about a subscriber's recent activity. Use the new activity-feed endpoint to access more events for a given contact.

list-member-activity-feed.title: Member Activity Feed
list-member-activity-feed.description: Get details about a subscriber's recent activity.

list-member-goal.title: Member Goals
list-member-goal.description: Get information about recent goal events for a specific list member.

list-member-notes.title: Member Notes
list-member-notes.description: Retrieve recent notes for a specific list member.

list-member-tags.title: Member Tags
list-member-tags.description: Manage all the tags that have been assigned to a contact.

list-member-events.title: Events
list-member-events.description: Use the Events endpoint to collect website or in-app actions and trigger targeted automations.

list-locations.title: Locations
list-locations.description: Get the locations (countries) that the list's subscribers have been tagged to based on geocoding their IP address.

reports.title: Reports
reports.description: Manage campaign reports for your Mailchimp account. All Reports endpoints are read-only. Mailchimp's campaign and automation reports analyze clicks, opens, subscribers' social activity, e-commerce data, and more. Note: Campaign IDs for A/B Testing Campaigns are available through the Campaign API Endpoint's Read method.

campaign-abuse.title: Campaign Abuse
campaign-abuse.description: Get information about campaign abuse complaints.

campaign-advice.title: Campaign Advice
campaign-advice.description: Get recent feedback based on a campaign's statistics.

open-reports.title: Campaign Open Reports
open-reports.description: Get a detailed report about any emails in a specific campaign that were opened by the recipient.

click-reports.title: Click Reports
click-reports.description: Get detailed information about links clicked in campaigns.

campaign-ecommerce-product-activity.title: Ecommerce Product Activity
campaign-ecommerce-product-activity.description: Ecommerce product activity report for a campaign.

link-clickers.title: Click Reports Members
link-clickers.description: Get information about specific subscribers who clicked on links in a campaign.

domain-performance-reports.title: Domain Performance
domain-performance-reports.description: Get statistics for the top-performing domains from a campaign.

eepurl-reports.title: EepURL Reports
eepurl-reports.description: Get a summary of social activity for the campaign, tracked by EepURL.

email-activity-reports.title: Email Activity
email-activity-reports.description: Get list member activity for a specific campaign.

location-reports.title: Location
location-reports.description: Get top open locations for a specific campaign.

sub-reports.title: Sub-Reports
sub-reports.description: A list of reports for child campaigns of a specific parent campaign. For example, use this endpoint to view Multivariate, RSS, and A/B Testing Campaign reports.

unsub-reports.title: Unsubscribes
unsub-reports.description: Get information about list members who unsubscribed from a specific campaign.

templates.title: Templates
templates.description: Manage your Mailchimp templates. A template is an HTML file used to create the layout and basic design for a campaign.

template-default-content.title: Default Content
template-default-content.description: Manage the default content for a Mailchimp template.

ecommerce-stores.title: E-commerce Stores
ecommerce-stores.description: Connect your E-commerce Store to Mailchimp to take advantage of powerful reporting and personalization features and to learn more about your customers.

ecommerce-customers.title: Customers
ecommerce-customers.description: Add Customers to your Store to track their orders and to view E-Commerce Data for your Mailchimp lists and campaigns. Each Customer is connected to a Mailchimp list member, so adding a Customer can also add or update a list member.

ecommerce-promo-rules.title: Promo Rules
ecommerce-promo-rules.description: Promo Rules help you create promo codes for your campaigns. Promo Rules define generic information about promo codes like expiration time, start time, amount of discount being offered etc. For a given promo rule you can define if it's a percentage discount or a fixed amount and if it applies for the order as a whole or if it's per item or free shipping. You can then create promo codes for this price rule. Promo codes contain the actual code that is applied at checkout along with some other information. Price Rules have one to many relationship with promo codes.

ecommerce-promo-codes.title: Promo Codes
ecommerce-promo-codes.description: Promo codes can be created for a given price rule. All the promo codes under a price rule share the generic information defined for that rule like the amount, type, expiration date etc. Promo code defines the more specific information about a promo code like the actual code, redemption_url, usage_count, etc that's unique to a code. Promo Code must be defined under a promo rule.

ecommerce-orders.title: Orders
ecommerce-orders.description: Orders represent successful e-commerce transactions, and this data can be used to provide more detailed campaign reports, track sales, and personalize emails to your targeted consumers, and view other e-commerce data in your Mailchimp account.

ecommerce-order-lines.title: Order Lines
ecommerce-order-lines.description: Each Order contains one or more Order Lines, which represent a specific Product Variant that a Customer purchases.

ecommerce-products.title: Products
ecommerce-products.description: E-commerce items for sale in your store need to be created as Products so you can add the items to a Cart or an Order. Each Product requires at least one Product Variant.

ecommerce-product-variants.title: Product Variants
ecommerce-product-variants.description: A Product Variant represents a specific item for purchase, and is contained within a parent Product. At least one Product Variant is required for each Product.

ecommerce-product-images.title: Product Images
ecommerce-product-images.description: A Product Image represents a specific product image.

ecommerce-carts.title: Carts
ecommerce-carts.description: Use Carts to represent unfinished e-commerce transactions. This can be used to create an Abandoned Cart workflow, or to save a consumer’s shopping cart pending a successful Order.

ecommerce-cart-lines.title: Cart Lines
ecommerce-cart-lines.description: Each Cart contains one or more Cart Lines, which represent a specific Product Variant that a Customer has added to their shopping cart.

ping.title: Ping
ping.description: A health check endpoint for Mailchimp API 3.0.

reporting-facebook-ads.title: Facebook Ads
reporting-facebook-ads.description: Get information about Facebook Ad reports.

reporting-landing-pages.title: Landing Pages
reporting-landing-pages.description: Get information about Landing Page reports.

search-campaigns.title: Search Campaigns
search-campaigns.description: Search all of an account's campaigns for the specified query terms.

search-members.title: Search Members
search-members.description: Search the account or a specific list for members that match the specified query terms.

verified-domains.title: Verified Domains
verified-domains.description: Manage the domains on your account that can be used for sending email campaigns.
